column1: Leila and Eugene Clark were properly impressed with the new house; yet
column3: were quite ready to stop their play that they might do justice to the big cake with its nine candles
column4: and its wreath of flowers; while the amount of ice cream eaten showed plainly that the refreshments were quite to the taste of the guests. Leila brought Dimple a box of candy
column5: and Eugene presented her with a bunch of beautiful roses. Rock
column7: although he hardly could spare the time to rush home and get his gift for her
column8: had something to donate; an exquisite little fan with carved ivory sticks
column9: that he said was made in China
column10: and which his mother had bought in California. Mrs. Hardy added to the gift a dainty pink sash
column11: and Florence had struggled in secret to make Rubina a new frock and had succeeded very well. So Dimple felt herself bountifully remembered.
